<h3 style="margin-left: 420px;">
<u>The McCulloch-Pitts model</u>
</h3><p style="margin-left: 400px;"><img src="data:image/jpeg;base64,"></p><p>This is an n input neuron, the n inputs being W1, W2 and W3.
The neuron takes their weighted sum, the weights being W1, W2 &amp; W3. This
weighted sum is then compared to a threshold value T; if the sum is greater the
output is high else the output is low. This is the fundamental basis of a
neural network. Several such neurons can combine to form a complex neural network
and can implement various types of conventional logic gates as well as networks
with specific purposes such as character recognition.  </p><p>Neural networks are often used in fields that require and
benefit from rapid parallel processing like image processing, voice
recognition, pattern recognition, etc.</p><p><img width="343" height="259" src="file:///C:/Users/vishrant/AppData/Local/Temp/msohtmlclip1/01/clip_image002.png" v:shapes="Picture_x0020_3"></p>
